intro: Eulophidium latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf eulophidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands or stream banks. Its reproductive structures include both stamens and pistils, facilitating cross-pollination by insects. Eulophidium latifolium is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
